On Wed, 2004-07-14 at 06:01, zhousp wrote:
> hi,developers,
> 
> I want use lucene to index the Arcfile, and save the url posion into the index .
> 
> At first I want write my own ARCReader from extends the org.archive.io.arc.ARCReader,
> 
> But the variable "InputStream in" is protected and I can't get it from my class.
> 
> Would you like change 
> 
> protected InputStream in = null;
> 
> to public or add this method :
> 
> public long getPoint() throws IOException{
>     	return ((Position)this.in).getFilePointer();
>     }

Just a word of caution:  Using the file pointer when handling compressed
ARC files is dangerous, at least if you're trying to use
GZipInputStream.  GZipInputStream reads a block (of some size) at a
time, and so the file pointer moves past the end of the ARC entry. 
Since there's no way to get the size of the compressed entry (AFAICS), a
Java-based scanning of compressed ARC files would entail reimplementing
the gzip reader.

Just one reason I don't like the compressed ARC files much.

-Lars
